metadata.title: CVE-2018-5390 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Linux kernel versions 4.9+ can be forced to make very expensive calls totcp_collapse_ofo_queue() and tcp_prune_ofo_queue() for every incomingpacket which can lead to a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5390` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-133-generic - 4.4.0-133.159
linux-image-4.4.0-133-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-133.159
linux-image-4.4.0-133-lowlatency - 4.4.0-133.159
linux-image-4.4.0-133-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-133.159
linux-image-4.4.0-133-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-133.159
linux-image-4.4.0-133-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-133.159
linux-image-4.4.0-133-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-133.159
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-133-generic - 4.4.0-133.159
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1094.102
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1098-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1098.103
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1065-aws - 4.4.0-1065.75
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-30-generic - 4.15.0-30.32~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-30-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-30.32~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-30-lowlatency - 4.15.0-30.32~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-30-generic - 4.15.0-30.32~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-30-lowlatency - 4.15.0-30.32~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1019-azure - 4.15.0-1019.19~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1015-gcp - 4.15.0-1015.15~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1031-kvm - 4.4.0-1031.37
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-9029-euclid - 4.4.0-9029.31
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-9029-euclid - 4.4.0-9029.31
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-133.159').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1094.102').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.103').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1065.75').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-30.32~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1019.19~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1015.15~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1031.37').
linux-euclid package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9029.31').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
